newsitem.title: HUNGARY: MOL president to give up his MP post.
newsitem.headline: MOL president to give up his MP post.

text.p: The president of Hungary's oil and gas company MOL Rt, Laszlo Pal, told his constituency he will resign from his post as member of parliament but will stay as the head of the oil company.
National daily newspaper Nepszabadsag quoted Pal as saying he made his decision ahead of a May 4 deadline because uncertainty could have a negative impact on the company's planned privatisation.
Under a recently-passed conflicts of interest bill, MPs who are on the boards of companies in which the state has a stake greater than 10 percent have to choose between the two positions by May 4.
The Hungarian state privatisation agency APV is expected to offer a further stake in MOL, the highest capitalised stock on the Budapest bourse, this year.
Foreign oil firms will be prevented from gaining a majority stake to maintain MOL as the "national oil company".
A 12 to 18 percent stake is likely to be offered in the coming months.
Altogether between 28 and 33 percent will be sold to financial investors and a yet-to-be-decided stake offered to MOL staff.
